intro: Pratia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian pratia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have four to five petals, displaying shades of white, pink, or red.
